justification: The study uses the Schizotypal Personality Questionnaire (SPQ) to assess thought disorder, specifically schizotypal personality, as part of the HiTOP psychological traits.

measured_by: Othmer and DeSouza Test for Detection of Somatization Disorder
justification: The Othmer and DeSouza Test is employed to evaluate somatoform disorders, which are characterized by symptoms like somatization within the HiTOP dimensions.
The State and Trait Anxiety Inventory (STAI), divided into two subscales, was used to measure internalizing traits, including anxiety.
The Plutchik Impulsivity Scale is used in the study to measure disinhibited externalizing traits, focused on impulsivity.
Detachment, especially in the form of anhedonia, is measured using the Revised Physical Anhedonia Scale (RPhA).
The Hypersensitive Narcissism Scale (HSNS) is utilized to assess antagonistic externalizing traits, particularly hypersensitive narcissism.
